segments.pli: Aṅguttara Nikāya 8
segments.en: Numbered Discourses 8

segments.pli: 3. Gahapativagga
segments.en: 3. Householders

segments.pli: 26. Jīvakasutta
segments.en: 26. With Jīvaka

segments.pli: Ekaṃ samayaṃ bhagavā rājagahe viharati jīvakambavane.
segments.en: At one time the Buddha was staying near Rājagaha in Jīvaka’s Mango Grove.

segments.pli: Atha kho jīvako komārabhacco yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā ekamantaṃ nisīdi. Ekamantaṃ nisinno kho jīvako komārabhacco bhagavantaṃ etadavoca:
segments.en: Then Jīvaka Komārabhacca went up to the Buddha, bowed, sat down to one side, and said to him,

segments.pli: “kittāvatā nu kho, bhante, upāsako hotī”ti?
segments.en: “Sir, how is a lay follower defined?”

segments.pli: “Yato kho, jīvaka, buddhaṃ saraṇaṃ gato hoti, dhammaṃ saraṇaṃ gato hoti, saṅghaṃ saraṇaṃ gato hoti;
segments.en: “Jīvaka, when you’ve gone for refuge to the Buddha, the teaching, and the Saṅgha,

segments.pli: ettāvatā kho, jīvaka, upāsako hotī”ti.
segments.en: you’re considered to be a lay follower.”

segments.pli: “Kittāvatā pana, bhante, upāsako sīlavā hotī”ti?
segments.en: “But how is an ethical lay follower defined?”

segments.pli: “Yato kho, jīvaka, upāsako pāṇātipātā paṭivirato hoti … pe … surāmerayamajjapamādaṭṭhānā paṭivirato hoti;
segments.en: “When a lay follower doesn’t kill living creatures, steal, commit sexual misconduct, lie, or use alcoholic drinks that cause negligence,

segments.pli: ettāvatā kho, jīvaka, upāsako sīlavā hotī”ti.
segments.en: they’re considered to be an ethical lay follower.”

segments.pli: “Kittāvatā pana, bhante, upāsako attahitāya paṭipanno hoti, no parahitāyā”ti?
segments.en: “But how do we define a lay follower who is practicing to benefit themselves, not others?”

segments.pli: “Yato kho, jīvaka, upāsako attanāva saddhāsampanno hoti, no paraṃ saddhāsampadāya samādapeti … pe …
segments.en: “A lay follower is accomplished in faith, but doesn’t encourage others to do the same. They’re accomplished in ethical conduct … they’re accomplished in generosity … they like to see the mendicants … they like to hear the true teaching … they memorize the teachings … they examine the meaning …

segments.pli: attanāva atthamaññāya dhammamaññāya dhammānudhammappaṭipanno hoti, no paraṃ dhammānudhammappaṭipattiyā samādapeti.
segments.en: Understanding the meaning and the teaching, they practice accordingly, but they don’t encourage others to do the same.

segments.pli: Ettāvatā kho, jīvaka, upāsako attahitāya paṭipanno hoti, no parahitāyā”ti.
segments.en: That’s how we define a lay follower who is practicing to benefit themselves, not others.”

segments.pli: “Kittāvatā pana, bhante, upāsako attahitāya ca paṭipanno hoti parahitāya cā”ti?
segments.en: “But how do we define a lay follower who is practicing to benefit both themselves and others?”

segments.pli: “Yato kho, jīvaka, upāsako attanā ca saddhāsampanno hoti, parañca saddhāsampadāya samādapeti;
segments.en: “A lay follower is accomplished in faith and encourages others to do the same.

segments.pli: attanā ca sīlasampanno hoti, parañca sīlasampadāya samādapeti;
segments.en: They’re accomplished in ethical conduct and encourage others to do the same.

segments.pli: attanā ca cāgasampanno hoti, parañca cāgasampadāya samādapeti;
segments.en: They’re accomplished in generosity and encourage others to do the same.

segments.pli: attanā ca bhikkhūnaṃ dassanakāmo hoti, parañca bhikkhūnaṃ dassane samādapeti;
segments.en: They like to see the mendicants and encourage others to do the same.

segments.pli: attanā ca saddhammaṃ sotukāmo hoti, parañca saddhammassavane samādapeti;
segments.en: They like to hear the true teaching and encourage others to do the same.

segments.pli: attanā ca sutānaṃ dhammānaṃ dhāraṇajātiko hoti, parañca dhammadhāraṇāya samādapeti;
segments.en: They readily memorize the teachings they’ve heard and encourage others to do the same.

segments.pli: attanā ca sutānaṃ dhammānaṃ atthūpaparikkhitā hoti, parañca atthūpaparikkhāya samādapeti;
segments.en: They examine the meaning of the teachings they’ve memorized and encourage others to do the same.

segments.pli: attanā ca atthamaññāya dhammamaññāya dhammānudhammappaṭipanno hoti, parañca dhammānudhammappaṭipattiyā samādapeti.
segments.en: Understanding the meaning and the teaching, they practice accordingly and they encourage others to do the same.

segments.pli: Ettāvatā kho, jīvaka, upāsako attahitāya ca paṭipanno hoti parahitāya cā”ti.
segments.en: That’s how we define a lay follower who is practicing to benefit both themselves and others.”

segments.pli: Chaṭṭhaṃ.

sections.title: At one time the Buddha was staying near Rājagaha…

suttaplex.blurb: Questioned by Jīvaka Komārabhacca, the Buddha explains what makes someone a Buddhist lay follower, a virtuous lay follower, and a lay follower practicing for the welfare of all.
